title: Routine Child & Adult Vaccines
description: Let the Allen County Department of Health be your main resource for information on testing, vaccinations, public records, licensing and more!
cleaned_text: Routine Child & Adult Vaccines It is important for adults and children to keep up with routine immunizations, and the Department of Health is here to help. Vaccinations are by appointment only, and most private insurances as well as Medicaid and Medicare are accepted; Medicare Part D also covers certain vaccines. Please call [260.449.7504 ](tel:2604497504)for more information and to make an appointment. Vaccines for Children & Adolescents Children who are not vaccinated are at increased risk of being infected by serious and potentially fatal diseases and can spread these diseases to others in their classrooms and community, including babies who are too young to be fully vaccinated and people with weakened immune systems. The Department of Health's Immunization Clinic administers the following vaccines: Due to an unpredictable vaccine supply, not all vaccines are available at all times for adults. Please ask about pricing when making an appointment. Some uninsured or under-insured children may be eligible for free vaccines under the federal [Vaccines for Children](http://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/programs/vfc/index.html) program. [For children and teens through 18 of age](#accordion4-1) [COVID-19](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/index.html) [DTaP](http://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/vis/vis-statements/dtap.html)(diptheria, pertussis, acellular pertussis) [Tdap](http://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/vis/vis-statements/tdap.html)(tetanus, Hours Call [260.449.7504 ](tel:2604497504)during normal business hours to schedule an immunization appointment. Clinic Location Medical Annex 4813 New Haven Ave. Parking Parking is free, and the clinic is located along a Citilink bus route, Bus No. 10. Hours Monday-Friday 8 a.m. to noon and 1 to 4:30 p.m. Planning Your Visit? If you are planning to visit our clinic, please download or print the [health history form](https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/assets.allencountyhealth.com/uploads/Downloads/Health-History-for-Adult-Child-Vaccinations-_Final.pdf?v=1643837514) for you or your child and bring with you to the appointment. If someone other than the parent or legal guardian is bringing the child to our Immunization Clinic, the parent must sign an temporary guardianship consent form below and attach a copy of his/her driver's license.
